descriptionSet.description: This poster calendar of Robert Barbour & Brother depicts different women in various costumes. The corners of the poster bear depictions of famous Indian tourist spots such as the Taj Mahal. There is a picture of a forearm holding a golden key in its hand in the lower middle of the poster.

inscription.text: With compliments from Robt. Barbour & Bro. Manchester
With best wishes for a prosperous year From Robt. Barbour & Bro. Manchester Merchants & Shippers to all Markets of the World.

Leading Specialities Domettes. Printed and Dyed. Prints. Shirting and Fancy. Woollens, Flannels, Meltons, Coatings, Army Cloths etc. Fancies, Oxfords, Flannelettes, Zephyrs, Trouserings, Velvets, etc. Sarries, Printed and White. Shirtings, Grey and White. Nainsooks, Dhooties etc. Hand & Key White Shirtings.
Armitage & Ibbetson, Ltd., Lithos, Manchester & Bradford.
Virtute Tutus Ich Dien Virtute Tutus
Palace of Udaipur from the Lake.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: With Compliments from Robert Barbour & Brother, Manchester

description-en: This poster calendar of Robert Barbour & Brother depicts different women in various costumes. The corners of the poster bear depictions of famous Indian tourist spots such as the Taj Mahal. There is a picture of a forearm holding a golden key in its hand in the lower middle of the poster. (ma/gs/tb)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: /20080502_0484.jpg
explanatory comments/crosstagging: The Barbours were manufacturers and traders of linen. (ys)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Robt. Barbour & Brother was the trading name of George Beatson Blair and James Thomas Blair, Manchester, merchants and shippers, cf. http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/A2A/records.aspx?cat=127-m294&cid=4-5-3-3#4-5-3-3 (ma)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: George Beatson Blair lived 1859-1940, James Thomas Blair lived 1863-1917, cf. http://www.ainslie.org.uk/genealogy/barbour/dat12.htm#16 (ma)

related hyperlinks: http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/A2A/records.aspx?cat=127-m294&cid=4-5-3-3#4-5-3-3, last accessed 2012-01-18, document of 1 Ja. 1909, held at Manchester Archives and Local Studies which identifies the Blair brothers George Beatson and James Thomas with "Robt. Barbour and Brother" (ma)
related hyperlinks: http://www.ainslie.org.uk/genealogy/barbour/dat12.htm#16, last accessed 2012-01-18, genealogy data record (ma)
